oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Video of Christopher Ammons describing how he was wounded in Vietnam
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. Users are solely responsible for determining the existence of such instances and for obtaining any other permissions and paying associated fees that may be necessary for the intended use.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Christopher Ammons describes typical patrols during his first tour in Vietnam and an incident that resulted in his sustaining an injury. His unit was ambushed while on patrol and he was struck in the back of the head by shrapnel from a rocket propelled grenade. He received a Purple Heart for the wound. The 4:24 minute video is cut from the full interview.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Military personnel; Soldiers; Veterans
Ammons. Christopher D., 1948- ; United States. Army; Vietnam War, 1961-1975; Vietnam
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ammons, Christopher D., 1948-
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Christopher D. Ammons was born in Norfolk, Virginia, on April 18, 1948. He enlisted in the Army on June 1, 1967, and served first with the 1st Infantry Division and later with the 194th Military Police Company. He served two tours in Vietnam, 1967-1968 and 1969-1970.
